channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump threatens military action in Nigeria over Christian persecution claims
item.description: President Trump on Saturday said he's ordered the Pentagon to plan for potential military action in Nigeria, where he alleges the government is failin...

item.title: US carries out new strike in Caribbean, killing 3 alleged drug smugglers
item.description: The U.S. military has carried out another lethal strike on alleged drug smugglers in the Caribbean Sea.

item.title: Daylight saving time ends Sunday. Here's what to know
item.description: Love it or hate it, many will turn their clocks back on Sunday. The debate — whether or not to make daylight saving time permanent — continues.

item.title: 10 people hospitalized after UK train stabbing attack, 9 with life-threatening injuries
item.description: British police said 10 people have been hospitalized, nine with life-threatening injuries, following a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train Sa...

item.title: 2 more suspects are charged in the Louvre jewel heist
item.description: A man and a woman, both in their late 30s, were charged with organized crime and being an accomplice, respectively. In total, four people have been ch...

item.title: The Boy Who Killed His Twin
item.description: A teenager stabs his sister – a crime with no known motive. His defense says he was sleepwalking. "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.

item.title: Daylight saving time ends as clocks "fall back"
item.description: Daylight saving time ended on Sunday, Nov. 2, 2025, when the clocks fell back and we gained an hour.

item.title: Uncertainty over federal food aid rises as shutdown fight continues
item.description: Rulings by two federal judges eased pressure on SNAP benefits, although President Trump said payments are likely to be delayed.

item.title: Devastation on repeat: How climate change is worsening Pakistan's deadly floods
item.description: The BBC speaks to those who have lost everything in this year's monsoon season and finds out why it will likely happen again.

item.title: Britons evacuated from Jamaica as UK sends Hurricane Melissa aid
item.description: Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper has said the UK's first chartered flight from Jamaica to the UK will arrive on Sunday.

item.title: 2 suspects sought in intentional explosion at Harvard Medical School building
item.description: Police say an explosion inside a building on the Harvard Medical School campus in Boston early Saturday morning appears to have been an intentional ac...

item.title: Dodgers seal back-to-back World Series titles
item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers become the first team for 25 years to win back-to-back World Series after overcoming the Toronto Blue Jays in the deciding sev...

item.title: Dodgers win World Series, defeat Blue Jays in Game 7 classic
item.description: The Dodgers become the first repeat champion since the 1998-2000 New York Yankees

item.title: Tracking the ICE tactics used in Trump's mass deportation drive
item.description: BBC Verify has gathered more than 70 videos to track how President Trump's illegal immigration crackdown has unfolded so far.

item.title: New Yorkers could pick a political newcomer to run their city - and take on Trump
item.description: From hip-hop musician to the brink of running America's biggest city, how did Zohran Mamdani win over New Yorkers?

item.title: SNAP benefits cut off during shutdown, driving long lines at food pantries
Uncertainty over federal food aid grows as the shutdown fight reaches a crisis point
item.description: The twin crises at the heart of the government shutdown fight in Washington are coming to a head. The federal food assistance program is facing delays...

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
